com.google.inject.tools.ideplugin.module
Interface ModuleRepresentation

All Known Implementing Classes:
ModuleRepresentationImpl
public interface ModuleRepresentation

Representation of a module context in the user's code.

Author:
Darren Creutz

Nested Class Summary
static class ModuleRepresentation.ClassNotModuleException
          A runtime exception thrown when the class passed in does not implement Module.

Method Detail

getConstructors

java.lang.reflect.Constructor<? extends com.google.inject.Module>[] getConstructors()
Return all the Constructors the given module class has.

Returns:
an array of constructors

setConstructor

void setConstructor(java.lang.reflect.Constructor<? extends com.google.inject.Module> constructor,
                    java.lang.Object[] arguments)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                           java.lang.InstantiationException,
                           java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
Set the constructor to use when creating instances.

Parameters:
constructor - the Constructor to use
arguments - an array of arguments matching the constructor's signature
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the constructor is not accessible
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the arguments are not valid for the constructor
java.lang.InstantiationException - if we cannot instantiate the module class
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - if the target is invalid

getConstructor

java.lang.reflect.Constructor<? extends com.google.inject.Module> getConstructor()
Return the Constructor we are currently using. By default this will be the default constructor.

Returns:
the constructor we use

getArguments

java.lang.Object[] getArguments()
Return the arguments being passed to the constructor.

Returns:
the arguments

getInstance

com.google.inject.Module getInstance()
Return an instance of the module using the constructor and arguments passed in. By default the default constructor is used.

Returns:
the Module object

hasDefaultConstructor

boolean hasDefaultConstructor()
Tell if the module class has a default constructor.

Returns:
true when the module class has a default contructor.

isValid

boolean isValid()
Can the module be instantiated?

Returns:
